The Immigration debate is alive and well in the United States and Australia at the moment.

You know why,because the big political parties love everyone talking about it so they don't have to talk about the economy.

Everyone's swallowed it hook line and sinker and everyones giving the politicians an unscrutinized free rife when it comes to fiscal policy and management of the public purse.

Glad to see that Aussies aren't the only dummies,you guys are holding the flag up high as well.

"Without some knowledge of our sport it's easy to view it from the outside as an overly dangerous endeavor."

The only thing I need to know to judge this an overly dangerous endeavor is the following: racers "struggle to keep their vehicles under control at up to 80 mph" while spectators line a barrier-less track.

"The professional promoters of desert racing - like Mojave Desert Racing - work tirelessly to make it as safe as possible. Unfortunately, tragedies like this can happen."

This was not a tragedy. It was an entirely preventable loss of human life.

"Spectators take risks, thinking they are 100% safe, but nothing is truly 100% safe."

This doesn't even sound 80% or 90% safe.

"The driver of the race truck should not be held to blame. He did his best."

He consented to drive a vehicle on a course lined with unprotected spectators. That is a reckless act. If losing control of one's vehicle is doing his best, I'm not sure what doing his worst would be.

"Accidents happen."

This accident was entirely created by human decisions. It did not just happen.

Any parent who allows his or her children any where near the path of momentum in such races should be prosecuted for child endangerment.

It's amazing to me how the right uses the very people who they exploit to build their base. Make up an issue that can be tied to a specific racial group-welfare queens, illegal immigrants, building mosques- and a huge number of Americans will ignore the fact that they are pawns of the super-wealthy and focus on hatred for people directly below them on the social ladder.

"Let's hope the government doesn't respond in typical fashion by banning the races." (Comment 24)

--------------------------

Here's a nutty idea: let's NOT hope that.

When blatant disregard for personal safety needlessly forces the implementation of government-funded resources like police, fire, and emergency personnel and thus takes those services away from people who really need it (e.g., helpless elderly and infants; innocent people injured by drunk drivers), the government has every right to nose around and see exactly what's up.

If nothing else, such nosing around ensures that the rest of us don't get held hostage to the bug-eyed, bomb-shelter-loving, Armegeddon-hoping OK Corral free-for-all mentality that is overtaking the nation faster than Georgia kudzu and doesn't know NOT to stand within a few feet of a speeding, gigantic metal box.

...and after those that allow the employment of undocumented workers, ie the goverment! But ur right by implying these folks are trying to solve other problems, or just hawking hot air. I'm just glad this teaparty attitude was not pervasive during the Ellis Island years, or grandma might have been shot on sight or worse, sent back to the death camps in Europe at the time.

They are here to benefit economicly by undercuting legal workers and from free health care,free medical and free education and daycare for their children in Spanish.
NO Citizenship should ever be given as a reward to people illegally in the USA!
You either must be off your meds or....think about renouncing your U.S. Citizenship!

I agree with your points about people who do physical manual labor. such things should be considered. But, in the end, Social Security has always been a ponzi scheme. And, when addendum programs , like SSD made benefits easily attained -- we've all heard the stories about "crazy money" for rowdy schoolkids and how it has been wasted , for example -- for all sorts of reasons; the program became unmanageable and unsupportable.

Somthing has to be done.

..."Meanwhile, an aging population will eventually (over the course of the next 20 years) cause the cost of paying Social Security benefits to rise from its current 4.8 percent of G.D.P. to about 6 percent of G.D.P. To give you some perspective, that’s a significantly smaller increase than the rise in defense spending since 2001, which Washington certainly didn’t consider a crisis, or even a reason to rethink some of the Bush tax cuts."

Sooo...the projected rise in Social Security benefits is LESS, much less, than the rise in defense spending since 2001? Yet, the Republicans and ConservaDems deficit hawks would have us believe that Social Security will break the bank--break ALL the banks--and leave our grandchildren in the streets! Even the wealthy ones, I guess.

HA! Whatta bunch of mindless FEARMONGERS! It makes me crazy that these guys (and they are mostly guys) NEVER mention the costs of war--either past, present or future! I think they all live where the sun don't shine, and have never looked at the costs of war for our country in strictly financial terms--never mind the psychological costs. And, heaven forbid, they should comprehend the obvious increase in terrorism resulting from our invasions and occupations!

In my last comment I said that some American people were stupid, because they believed all of this scaredy-cat wingnut tripe about deathers and terrorist babies. But I am also coming to think that the deficit hawks are narrow minded, tunnel visioned (is that a word?) mostly rich guys, who stupidly want to throw away our country's money and the lives of our young lower-middle class men and women in impossible third world places! Because this apparently does not affect them or their defense industry buddies! I am just waiting for these bozos to come up with a plan to help Israel bomb Iran--and tell us that we need to do it for NATIONAL SECURITY! Therefore,cost is not an issue. Eeeek!

These are stupid people, and uncaring as well. And they think all of us are stupid too. Guess what, we are not! And we are not taking it anymore!

It is unusual but Krugman is correct today about Social Security. The Republicans are trying to steal the one benefit that Americans hope will be there for them.

Most Americans have no savings and no pension and paltry 401K's.

If the Republicans get there way they will privatize Social Security in another effort by the Plunge Protection Treasury Team to boost the Dow Jones.

Good job Krugman!

Why not raise the cap. The well off should pay their fair share to run the countries programs. Where is the sense of civic responsibility that made us a strong nation, able to endure.

I am not in favor of all the military spending the nation engages in~ but I have to pay taxes for it anyway. Why shouldn't the well off have to do the same?

Hats Off to Kruman---First the Republicans stole the Social Security Trust Fund and now they want to steal the Social Security Program completely.

If "W" had gotten his way in 2003 when he tried to privatize Social Security via Stock Market Investment---we would all be even deeper in the hole than we are now.

Don't allow the Republicans to steal our last Ponzi Scheme Retirement Plan. This is the last Ponzi Scheme still standing and millions of Baby Boomers are counting on Social Security.

Bernie Madoff's retirement plans were not big enough but with the backing of the U.S. Government we can at least be sure that the Social Security Ponzi scheme begun by FDR will pay out for a generation or two more.

We need to preserve the Social Security Ponzi Scheme.

Bravo, Mr. Krugman. Thank you for continuing to educate the public as to the unnecessary and harmful assault on Social Security by the powers that be in Washington.

I wrote a piece on my own personal blog that slayed several right-wing, zombie lies that are leading people to conclude falsely that Social Security is insolvent and needs to be "fixed."

http://thedonkeyedge.com...

We all need to be ever-vigilant in amplifying this message to the American people as frequently as possible.

The Jig's Up--there will be no Social Security money for anybody. The whole thing is a lie concocted to throw bread and ciruses or food stamps and crack cocaine to the masses.

Social Security was a great program at its inception but has been plundered by the government crooks and it is a lost cause.

The Jig's Up Baby!!!
I want social security terminated not because I am a conservative, but because I will manage my finances and prepare for my retirement far better than the federal government ever could.

I wonder whether Paul Krugman's objections to raising the retirement age could be addressed by tying the retirement age to some measure of lifetime earnings? In other words, lifetime "high earners" would have a later benefit date than "low earners."
Or does that do too much damage to Social Security's equity principal.

Hear, hear, Dr. K-

As we contemplate the 75th birthday of Social Security, it is our duty to prevent it's destruction by the politicians funded by corporations and Wall Street - point of fact is they have stolen the cash surplus built up in advance by the Boomers per the 1983 increases; they will have to replace what was stolen.

We have reached the inflection point where corporatism and pragmatism cannot be allowed to reach the Holy Grail they have sought since New Deal days.

People who cannot afford to move to Phoenix or Boca to retire will have to move in with their kids and grand-kids :)
